bham.leakiest

Class Observations

  • java.lang.Object
    • bham.leakiest.Observations

  • public class Observations
extends java.lang.Object
    This file contains the methods needed to turn a list of observations in a conditional probability matrix and calculate the possible error.
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Tom Chothia, Yusuke Kawamoto, Chris Novakovic

      • hasSufficientInputs

        public boolean hasSufficientInputs()
        Tests whether the number of unique inputs recorded in this Observations object is sufficient for estimating mutual information. The minimum required is 1.
        Returns:
        true if enough unique inputs have been collected to allow an accurate estimation of mutual information to be calculated; false if not.

      • hasSufficientOutputs

        public boolean hasSufficientOutputs()
        Tests whether the number of unique outputs recorded in this Observations object is sufficient for estimating mutual information. The minimum required is 1.
        Returns:
        true if enough unique outputs have been collected to allow an accurate estimation of mutual information to be calculated; false if not.

      • hasSufficientSamplesForMEL

        public boolean hasSufficientSamplesForMEL()
        Tests whether the sample size recorded in this Observations object is sufficient for estimating min-entropy leakage. We require that no more than 20% of the non-zero expected frequencies are below 5, while the expected frequencies are constructed from observed frequencies to find a confidence interval of min-entropy leakage. For efficiency of this test, we first check wether no more than 20% of the non-zero observed frequencies are below 5; if this is true, we next check wether no more than 20% of the non-zero expected frequencies are below 5.
        Returns:
        true if enough samples have been collected to allow an accurate estimation of min-entropy leakage to be calculated; false if not.

      • hasSufficientSamplesForMI

        public boolean hasSufficientSamplesForMI()
        Tests whether the sample size recorded in this Observations object is sufficient for estimating mutual information. The minimum required sample size is i * o * 4, where i is the number of unique inputs observed so far, and o is the number of unique outputs observed so far.
        Returns:
        true if enough samples have been collected to allow an accurate estimation of mutual information to be calculated; false if not.

      • largestInterval

        public double largestInterval()
        Find the largest confidence interval.
        Returns:
        the largest confidence interval
